etymologies: late 18th century: from modern Latin, from Greek trōgōn, from trōgein ‘gnaw’

definitions: a bird of tropical American forests, with a long tail and brilliantly colored plumage.

notes.text: Family Trogonidae: several genera, in particular Trogon, and many species; the quetzals also belong to this family

shortDefinitions: bird of tropical American forests, with long tail and brilliantly coloured plumage
